website_summaries.verdict: Low price point to receive USB 3.0 transfer speeds in 4 hubs, all in a thin and easy to carry hub device.
pros: Each port has its own power switch, allowing you to control each port individually
Easy to set up and use
Excellent option that provides 4 ports with 5Gbps transfer speeds at a desirable price
cons: Not recommended to run external hard drives

website_summaries.verdict: Sabrent’s line of USB hubs are extra-small and lightweight, making them the perfect solution for college students, or anyone who uses their Mac on the go.
pros: Each USB port has a power button
cons: Larger sizes with additional USB ports are available, but the price for these expanded models becomes steep fairly quickly
Its 8-inch USB 3.0 cable is fairly short

website_summaries.verdict: A great budget Sabrent USB hub equipped with a couple of energy-saving features to prevent power waste.
pros: The individual USB 3.0 ports come with separate switches to limit the power usage from unused ports
The hub is compatible with all older USB devices running on the 2.0 and 1.1 USB versions
cons: USB power connection limits the number of devices you can charge at the same time

customer_reviews.title: Good USB 3 hub. One minor issue -
customer_reviews.text: It appears to be a pretty solid USB 3 hub. Nice to have buttons that turn power on or off to each port. Be aware sometimes plugging in a new high power or data device may pause another port briefly. For example, when I plugged a portable hard drive in, the moment I pushed the power button to that port, my audio interface plugged into a different port disconnected briefly, before reconnecting. Then both were connected and seemed to work fine. But there may be an issue with high power devices affecting other ports. Other than that it is a solid unit with plenty of ports.
customer_reviews.author: DKP

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy 🤷🏽‍♀️
customer_reviews.text: Did not work out the box Waste of money. My computer has 1 USB and I need two externals for editing and such. Well one holds my sessions and one holds my editing tools. When I plugged it in it recognized both for maybe 4 minutes then nothing. The light on both externals are on however this dinky thing is not communicating back to my computer. I will recognize only one at a time sometimes. Wish I could give 0 stars
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Morales

customer_reviews.title: Power cuts off for no reason
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this item because it did not work properly. I bought it so I could charge multiple items at the same time from my MAC because my MAC only has one available USB port (My second USB port is used for my wireless mouse). After plugging in my headphones, iPad, and iPod I noticed they were not all charging. Apparently if the 4 port moved at any time, the power to some ports would drop out even though the switch light was still illuminated. I would then have to switch off the non working item and turn the switch back on to start the charging process again. That was unacceptable to me.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery Keim

customer_reviews.title: NOT USB 3.0 COMPATIBLE !!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this twice in good faith thinking I was running USB 3.0 hubs but kept having CPU crashes when working (I'm an audio engineer at a recording studio) – and I couldn't figure out why...until I noticed the truth about these hubs! They actually function as 2.0 hubs, not 3.0 !! PROFESSIONALS BEWARE! And to make it worse, the manufacturer is under a different name as you can see in the screenshot ("GenesysLogic Inc") its not even Sabrent. I dont know whats going on here...either Genesys is the parent company? Or someone is running a scam here. Either way, these hubs are fake. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Airic

customer_reviews.title: It caught on fire
customer_reviews.text: I have had this USB hub for a little over a month. It had been connected to my laptop nonstop without issue. Then I came home from the store yesterday to the smell of smoke. I discovered the USB hub swollen and fried. It also ruined a section of my computer monitor that was near the hub. So not super happy right now and terrified of what could have happened had the sparks ignited a large fire.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Affordable solution
customer_reviews.text: These little hubs are very good for my purposes. The blue illuminated buttons are a nice touch. I am one of 'those people' who have several peripherals attached to the computer. Having the ability to turn those devices on and off makes it nice. Plus, you can customize WHAT devices you have active. Side Note: For those of you that never considered this, the computer can only supply but so much voltage through a USB port. And that voltage is shared between connected devices. If you have too many devices on one port, you will get intermittent failures. These hubs let you customize that voltage demand
customer_reviews.author: Mark Douglas

customer_reviews.title: What's not to like?  10ports of USB3.0 goodness!
customer_reviews.text: The individual power switches for each port sold me on this hub. Sabrent has really hit a home-run with here. The cord lengths are just right. The power switches light up and are easily accessible...and it has TEN USB3.0 ports! Plus some of the ports support charging! Winner-winner. Instead of running all my USB3 gear direct to my PC, I just plug 'em into this amazing hub. No problems whatsoever. (Pardon the dust, I was in a hurry!)
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Ewasiuk

customer_reviews.title: Nice little device. Good value. It just works
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through a couple of inexpensive USB hubs trying to find one that Windows 10 doesn’t decide to forget what it is. I have had this one for a week and so far it has worked really well. The cord is a little long for my liking but me and the hub had a talk and decided to look beyond each other’s flaws and get along. I haven’t tried running my headset through it yet but me and headsets aren’t on speaking terms right now. If we ever decide to bury the hatchet I’ll update this review.
customer_reviews.author: MikeInMurphy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't power external hard drives
customer_reviews.text: I specifically got this model as it said it could power external hard drives. It can't. It won't even detect them. I tried 4 different hard drives (Transcend and WD) in both the regular ports and the charging ports and the brand new device didn't detect any of them. Small things like keyboard, mouse, flash drive, etc it detected, but not my external hard drives. Have to return it now.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine, but not with a WD 6 TB External HD
customer_reviews.text: As expected the Sabrent 4-Port USB 3.0 Hub with Individual Power Switches and LEDs (HB-UM43) arrived as promised. Based on the Amazon website heading "Frequently Bought Together," I also purchased it with the WD 6TB external HD. After multiple attempts, I was unable to setup the HD, while connecting it through the Sabrent Hub. Upon checking the WD website, I learned that the Sabrent can not be used with the WD. After connecting the HD directly to my computer, it works great. Don't know who is responsible (Amazon, Western Digital or Sabrent) for "suggesting" that they would work together, but someone needs to take responsibility and correct the problem!
customer_reviews.author: brhoff

customer_reviews.title: Awful lag with gaming mouse
customer_reviews.text: On very first use, I plugged in a gaming mouse that polls at 1 kHz. Every 10 seconds or so the cursor freeze up on the screen for about 500ms, which makes it unusable. This did not happen with my previous USB 3.0 hub (Pluggable). So I tested it when plugged in directly to the back of my PC. No problem. Thus, the culprit has to be this product. I will be returning it. It looks like Sabrent did not test this product very well -- at least not for real-time usages.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Handy, fast and well made
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used his for a few weeks now, it is light but well built and sturdy. If I had a complaint it would be that, even with the grip pad on the bottom, it tends to slide around my desk but that’s easy to deal with. It charges effectively, all ports work beautifully and the click of the buttons is solid which may seem trivial but I am not worried about them sticking or the spring wearing out. The transfer speeds are where I’d expect for a 3.0 USB hub and I like that it is not USB powered exclusively.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Careful What You Attach
customer_reviews.text: This device is good for low-power consuming attachments, such as thumb drives. Attaching devices that are dependent on USB only power seem to create a power bottleneck. In attaching 3 USB powered external portable drives, things seemed to become an issue. Attaching 4 thumb drives was no issue. Attaching a USB keyboard and USB mouse and 2 thumb drives was OK. If you are attaching something like a traditional external hard drive, it is best to use an AC powered enclosure. Charging an iPhone also seemed OK if no power draining drives were installed as well. OK product, just understand the limitations of solo USB powering.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Dunn

customer_reviews.title: compact convenient switched ports are a must have
customer_reviews.text: so I had a need to clean up my collection of ssds and thumb drives and having the 10 ports makes all the difference, the asthetics of the hub are great - compact, clean design, black, low profile switches I didn't give this 5 stars, because during heavy extended high speed transfers occasionally the whole hub would disconnect from win10, not sure where the fault lies - the hub or my laptop or wn 10 . . . so my personal advice to anyone planning on doing multiple file large data tranfers within win10 would be to do "copy" rather than "cut/move" to not risk file intergrity corruption
customer_reviews.author: Good Guy

customer_reviews.title: Simple, nice, easy-to-use USB replicator.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect much when I purchased this thing, but was pleasantly surprised by its simplicity and ease-of-use. I have a a couple of other USB adapters too, one that I paid a lot more money for than I did for this one. But it works, simple as that, and I have used it for a variety of things without having any problems with it. So of course, I would recommend buying it, if you are looking for a nice quality, simple USB adapter that works.
customer_reviews.author: David E Preston

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit, Even Better Customer Service !
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews of this usb multi port, I decided to make the purchase. Item appears to well built and sturdy in construction. One of the “off-on” buttons which switches power off and on to one of the ports was nonfunctional. I sent a message to supplier and within a week, received a second beautifully working unit. I realize that every so often, one item might slip by quality control and make it to market. No big deal. Especially when the vendor jumps right on the problem for fast and quick resolution. Great customer service !!! I would 100% purchase this item and vendor again and recommend it to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Old_Massey68

customer_reviews.title: Works great for a basic hub, lags a little with a wireless mouse
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use - just take it out of the box and plug it in to your computer. It's small and looks pretty sleek. I like having the power buttons for each USB port. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because there is a lag with wireless mice. I have a wireless mouse and when I plug the corresponding USB into the hub there is a noticeable lag when I move my mouse. I tried another wireless mouse I have just to be sure and the same thing happened. So, I just make sure to put THAT USB directly in the computer. The hub works great for everything else.
customer_reviews.author: E. Sander

customer_reviews.title: Compact USB 3.0 4-port hub
customer_reviews.text: The Sabrent 4-port USB 3.0 expansion hub is very compact, well made, high quality materials and hardware. Each port can be turned on and off with a dedicated push button switch. Each switch has a pleasant, unobstrusive blue LED indicator that shows which ports are turned on - very useful. The cord is sturdy, useful length. The ports are located on the long side of the hub, cables plug in sideways which is keeping my desk tidy and organized. I purchased this hub to replace one that had the four ports on its top surface - the Sabrent hub is the favorable solution for my workspace, greatly improving the cord routing. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: GMan

customer_reviews.title: This 4-port hub is unpowered
customer_reviews.text: When more than one device is connected to this hub, the available power (from the computer socket) is divided between them. There are many scenarios in which this will result in the devices not working. The documentation that comes with the hub makes that clear. It is prudent to order the company's power supply, rather than learn after you receive this unpowered hub that your USB devices will not work without a power supply to the hub.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S. Lynn, PhD

customer_reviews.title: Just died after a year of light use - Prevented iMac from booting
customer_reviews.text: I can understand how this can break if you are constantly adding/removing devices but it just sat with a couple of devices plugged into it in a climate controlled and relatively dust free office. It didn't have enough power to run external HDD's, didn't recognize devices or would drop connection with flash drives at random. The final straw: Kept my iMac from booting after a year of use. Unplugged it, everything went back to normal. Plugged it back in, no reboot. I just threw it away and put my 7-year old powered USB hub and it works fine. Total garbage, don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: External power sourced peripherals trump USB powered any day.
customer_reviews.text: I like this USB because simply it works. For how long remains to be seen. Had to return another brand and another died after only 2 years. Also has more power due to it's external power source. My external HD runs fine from it as a result. I'm so tired of poor performance and unreliability of USB powered &*^&% regardless of use whether it be a USB hub or a CD reader. I like that the USB connectors go in vertically; Saves a lot of space and allows easy access. Switches are easy to access: No plug/unplugging either. Haven't used the Smart charge slots yet.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Searle

customer_reviews.title: Effective as a power switch
customer_reviews.text: To effectively shut down USB-powered music equipment (microphone, MIDI controllers, audio interfaces, etc.) this hub works wonderfully. Rather than needing to unplug many devices when not in use (especially those with annoying lights or lacking a power button), this hub allowed push-button control for USB power. The power switches on this hub disconnect not only the USB connector's data contacts but the power contacts as well.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Not good for hard drives
customer_reviews.text: FWIW my mac won't wake from sleep with hard drives plugged into this hub. I have 4 drives (all USB3, some powered), and once the computer goes to sleep it won't wake up. I also have a cheap $8 AmazonBasics 4-port powered hub for my USB2 peripherals (keyboard etc), so I swapped hubs and put the peripherals into this Sabrent, and the drives into the cheap hub, and voila the computer wakes up quickly. So in my experience it's good for peripherals, not so good for hard drives on a mac.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Follow-Up Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: This 4-port USB hub is working great, although I encountered some problems that I originally attributed to it. The seller (Store4PC) was patient & helpful throughout the troubleshooting process. It turns out that something flaky seems to be happening with one of the USB ports on my laptop. This isn't the first product I've purchased from the seller, and I've never been disappointed by them. If you need to expand your USB capacity, then this hub will do the trick. Also, if other products sold by Store4PC fit a need you have, then I encourage you to buy from them with confidence. They do a great job!
customer_reviews.author: DB in CV

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work-poor return policy
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work. Got it running butimmediately stopped working day 1. Hard to believe the good reviews - see lots of 5’s then lots of 1’s which make me wonder if they have poor quality control. Useless and poor return policy- told me only option is to go out in pandemic to UPS store or pay for UPS pick up myself. I had high hopes for this but am very disappointed with the product and the vendors return options.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for only 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in March 2020, and beginning in Sept 2020 some of the devices were no longer recognized, or it would not recognize all devices if all slots used. The mouse and keyboard were particularly problematic. When I plug in an additional external hard drive, the mouse suddenly stops working. At first I thought it was the mouse and keyboard themselves, but they work fine on other laptops, and they work fine when plugged directly into my laptop. I give it 2 stars because it worked great when it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: It's Handling And Working Like A Charm
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I have purchased other products from this company in the past. So I knew I could count on them. And boy was I right. This thing is awesome. I also love how it has the buttons on the side to turn off whichever USB is connected. I have this almost full. I have only 1 slot left. And all my peripherals have no issues what so ever. I do not have any external hard drives connected so I can't speak on that. I have my steering wheel, shifter, webcam, 2 usb studio lights, and my Arctic 5 headphones. And No issues at all. I highly highly recommend this product to anyone. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob L.

customer_reviews.title: Docking station is better!
customer_reviews.text: I tried putting 2 monitors, 4 external hard drives, 1 keyboard, 1 lamp, 1 printer and a 4-port usb hub so I can still add a mouse and a usb jump drive. After first time installation, all ports worked except for the keyboard. Second time, still no keyboard and just 1 monitor is working. Subsequent times - - my laptop was having a hard time rebooting. Had to give up, dismantled everything and went back to my 5-yr old 6-port docking station. It would have been pretty bad already if only 1 monitor could work, but not to have the keyboard working was worse. Two stars for me!
customer_reviews.author: fba

customer_reviews.title: Not all ports were functioning; good after replacement
customer_reviews.text: It was fine at first. I plugged it in with three other cords set up and found no problems. Today I wanted to change the cords around and add another. Now suddenly only two ports will let me put the cords in all the way. Then three, kinda. I am very annoyed that I cannot seem to actually use all the ports. Update: now one port works, so it is completely worthless. Update 2: returned it and got a new one. Works fine again. My advice is to just plug in exactly what you will need and don't change them (at least for a ps4. mine is also a very old one so that may impact it).
customer_reviews.author: Kristi P

customer_reviews.title: Can't tell if on/off indicator lights are lit in a well lit office
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically because it had on/off indicator lights not embedded in the USB ports, so I though they would be easy to see. When the hub is laying flat In a well lit office, I can't see the indicators. I've tilted it up and leaned it against my label printer, but even then it's hard to see due to glare off the plastic cover, and the recessed lights are hidden if you're not looking directly onto the top. I wanted the on/off switches so I can see what's active because with Mac Catalina OS, my Brother portable scanner will not work if a Brother printer is also plugged in via USB.
customer_reviews.author: Button Watkins

customer_reviews.title: The buttons do NOT disable the ports completely
customer_reviews.text: The special thing about this hub is the buttons that are supposed to selectively disabled the ports, yet what those buttons actually do is simply cutting the Vbus line, turning the 5V supply off. This disables any devices powered by this line, such as flashs drive, bluetooth dongles and alike, and also disables any externally powered device that uses Vbus detection to enable it's USB functionality. This covers an absolute majority of the devices, but not ALL of them, and i've already discovered one externally powered proprietary device, which couldn't care less about the state of that button.
customer_reviews.author: Boris

customer_reviews.title: Dependable usb hub
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because my laptop only had 1 usb connection. I would have multiple things connected but i cannot say if it drains the laptop battery since i only used it for bluetooth transmitters and external hard drives. I am not sure if you are able to charge your phone on this. But i can say this device is extremely reliable. I have this installed in my computer setup at a smog check shop and rely on this to keep by barcode scanners, and printer connected at all times. If i were to need anymore than i would buy again. Definitely would recommend to a friend. I just wish that they would make the wire longer.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo A.M

customer_reviews.title: Just didn't work how it should have.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on a PS4 to split between a charge cord and a bluetooth headset dongle. It worked well the first 2 days from then on it has been intermittent at best. I thought at first maybe it was the PS4 outlet cause I had switched it for better wire management but when I switched back same issue. The product seemed like it was going to do the job but fell short. I'm not even using it now.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos A.

customer_reviews.title: The buttons are great for camera security
customer_reviews.text: I initially purchased some inline USB toggle switches because I did not trust that the video AND audio on my webcam were disabled when the light is off. Having an inline switch lets me control the inputs rather than software. I needed a USB hub for my KVM and this popped up in the search. The hub is incredibly light, making it feel a bit weak for impact (might not be good as a travel unit that will get banged around all of the time). The light indicators on each of the ports are only on when the switch is engaged and the blue light is low-intensity, so it is not annoying in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck B.

customer_reviews.title: Unobtrusive on the desktop but gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Modern laptops seem to come with fewer and fewer USB ports yet the need for these connections continues to grow. I'm using my laptop as a desktop machine and this hub allowed me to take the two USB ports that my very expensive Dell laptop arrived with and turn them into five usable connections (4 plus 1). There's a 4K display, a sound system, a printer, and a scanner all plugged into it and they work just fine. Since some of these devices are only used intermittently, the inclusion of on/off buttons with indicator lights for each connection is a handy feature.
customer_reviews.author: S. Horn

customer_reviews.title: Plentyof poweer for the Hub
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a powered hub, I tried a different on that was not provifing adquate power for the power ports on the hub. This one had teh same features, being able to turn on and off the ports and power my devices. Currently Microphone, Webcam, RGB Keyboard, two WD Easy Store Drive (4tb each) and a LG DVD Reader Writer. Power supply looks like one I would have for one of my laptops.
customer_reviews.author: Colegate V. Spinks

customer_reviews.title: If you are reading this...just hit add to cart
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this product. Does exactly what its supposed to do. I needed this device for my new laptop. I am running a wireless mouse and keyboard, an external drive, and an Xbox controller for gaming. This has turned my laptop into a fully functional desktop and I love it. The blue lights are awesome and being able to cut off power to individual ports is a plus! Price is more than fair and delivery time is exceptional. If you are hesitating from purchasing this product I suggest you don't as you will 100% miss out a steal of a deal.
customer_reviews.author: jeffro

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my laptop only has 2 USB ports. I often require 3 for school. This device allows you to turn 1 port into 4. You can plug devices in and use the buttons on top to turn it off without taking the cords out. It’s a great convenience. It also makes it super easy to move from one computer to another because you don’t have to unplug and replug every device. Initially, I thought the cord was going to be too long. But it works perfectly at a desk and gives enough wiggle room that it’s not blocking other ports etc. Overall, good purchase, easy to use, works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Cost - Nothing Special
customer_reviews.text: For a vast majority of people, this adapter should suffice. It's made out of plastic and feels very cheap. Compared to other plastic USB Hubs I've paid only a couple dollars more for, I much prefer those over this. If you're going to be using this in a fixed environment, such as with a desktop, it should work absolutely fine. For travel/mobility you may consider something else. The hub itself operates exactly as it should, and I'm not sure if it was just my unit but I found that some buttons were better illuminated than others. For a USB 3.0 Hub, it's an absolutely great price.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Initial impression good - push button convenient control
customer_reviews.text: Just rec'd and seems to work exactly as described. Needed to add ports on laptop due to using wireless keyboard and mouse (non-unified) and this seems to be good solution. One feature that I like more than expected is the ability to activate the individual ports by pressing the switch above the port. When "on", the blue square surrounding the switch is illuminated. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: goldenrool

customer_reviews.title: Very Usable switch
customer_reviews.text: This USB3 switch is Great! I have ExHDD and use them only occasionally, as backup, pictures, etc. With this switch I can leave them plugged in, simply press Switch to use, press again when done. Important for noisy drives, just replaced HDD with SSD, and what a wonderful room, now it'z not filled with headTravel Stutter, even to move mouse or keystroke. ... That said, the LED's are not boxed, difficult to determine which is active, which is simply lit by neighboring LED. And put a longer cord on the unit, Switches mean we turn them on and off multiple times and short cable makes viewing, turning on, off, or even determining which device is powered.
customer_reviews.author: PAUL B.

customer_reviews.title: The Best Hub I've Bought So Far
customer_reviews.text: As I continue to rely on non-powered physical drives, and a growing collection of them, I've had recurring problems with under-powered hubs, which I suspect are causing intermittent hard drive errors. This hub is the first consumer hub that allows individual ports to switch power on and off, and which actually admits to how much power the hub supplies overall (60W). The cord connecting the hub uses a transformer mid-cord, meaning it has a standard plug into my power strip, which is much appreciated. Good and sensible design, so far I'm extremely pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Philz

customer_reviews.title: Worked as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly - just as advertised. Note that you need an Ethernet cable to make the connection from the splitter to the device (e.g. router / modem / etc.) Provided is a power connection (small transformer?). Somewhat inconvenient is that the lights for the connections can only be easily viewed from the direction the connectors enter, which is typically AWAY from the user so the cables aren't extending into the room. And the lights don't line up with the cables. And the blinking lights on the cables in use reflect into the light windows for the non-connected slots making them also appear to be in use. Seems like a 'miss' or two on the part of the designers.
customer_reviews.author: Leroy

customer_reviews.title: Does not honor USB sleep mode
customer_reviews.text: One odd thing with this hub is that after I put the laptop to sleep all of the devices connected to the hub were still powered up. I'm not sure if this is the only powered USB3 hub which does this. I never had a problem with powered USB2 hubs. So, every time I sleep the laptop I first have to run down the row of switches to turn off all the devices first.
customer_reviews.author: Nameless Faceless OneTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Not ps4 compatible
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in hopes of being able to have more devices connected and to connect my hard drive along with my ps4 charge cable and my lego dimensions game pad, and what this did the minute I connected my ps4 controller? Its rendered my ps4 controller un-useable, I now have a new controller that does not work ever since I connected it. I also could not use my hard drive. Bad choice period!
customer_reviews.author: Samuel L Torres

customer_reviews.title: CRAP - DOES NOT WORK.
customer_reviews.text: I plugged it in, it does nothing. Literally nothing. It's a chunk of rubbish and I kept trying to get it to work, switching USB ports, updating my system, taking it to work to see if it would work with other computers. Now it's apparently too late to get a refund of return. DO NOT BUY THIS! More Chinese junk. So dissappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Pacini

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed to add more devices
customer_reviews.text: This port is POWERED, it plugs into the wall. I've found that's almost a necessity if you're plugging in several USBs. It also has two charging ports which is nice and convenient. What sold me though, since there were kinda similar hubs for less, is the maker, Sabrent. After purchasing my first Sabrent device, and external port that accepted drives designed for internal use also, I've purchased about 10 other products they make and I have always been exceptionally well-satisfied. To date, none have ever failed.
customer_reviews.author: The Glide

customer_reviews.title: Amazing usb hub and multiport.
customer_reviews.text: Really like it. It comes in a very well presented box, with all necessary cables, it allowed me to charge three devices with no problem, and also plug a midi keyboard and a usb interface with no problem, plus a usb memory. This works perfect. This thing is trully amazing. I have plugged my MOTU M2 audio interface, my Novation Launchkey mini MK3, a 256 Gb USB and charge my tablet and mobile, all at once with no problem. I had doubts on latency problems for the audio interface but is kept in just 12 Ms...
customer_reviews.author: Javier Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Good, wish they had more cord length options.
customer_reviews.text: Got it to use as a media storage bank for my Roku Ultra with a couple of high capacity flash drives so I can have some offline media content. Quality seems decent enough. The 2 foot cord is pretty short & really limits mounting options. Would have been nice if they had a 6 or even 9 foot cord option. You could always use a USB extension cable which is what I use to transfer data to & from the flash drives on the hub & my PC at my desk. Had some issues reading my old Maxtor hard drive but that could be the drive more than the hub.
customer_reviews.author: Sgt. Slab Wrankle Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Good quality design, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I use this usb hub with a Windows10 PC and is has worked very well for several months. I use the charge ports to charge my phone and other electronics and it charges fast, and I use the external power supply. I also use this usb hub to program microcontrollers such as Arduino and it has no problems with this, it is reliable. The buttons seem to be good quality, durable, and have good feel. The led indicator lights are a bit dim for my environment and difficult to see as they are embedded in the plastic, but this might be good if you want a low-light environment.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Great USB hub
customer_reviews.text: It is a great little hub if you do not over power it. It is meant for data devices NOT FOR CHARGING ITEMS. In reviewing this item it should be noted that Amazon asked me to rate the camera and also the charging power. USB hubs generally do not have cameras, so I do not think this should be held against this unit. When used properly, it really helps in being able to run a DAW studio. Great clean bandwidth. We can isolate inputs with this unit allowing for cleaner recordings and a more streamlined creation pipeline. Simple, but really good. Lighted switches are super useful in low light environments like live performances. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: POOR HORIZONTAL DESIGN. This unit can only accept four (4) 3/4 inch small USB plugs.
customer_reviews.text: There is a limit of 3/4 inch space between the plugs. Therefore anything wider than 3/4 inch such as the SanDisk 231Gb Flash Drive or wider than 3/4 Inch USB plugs for Microphones cannot be plugged side by side. The plugs in this product should have been designed upright rather than horizontal to give room for wider units. You will need to buy USB 3.0 extensions to fit four plugs in. I ordered the 7 port 7 Ports USB 3.0 HUB USB Splitter With On/Off Switch Platooninsert For Computer Peripherals (White) Sold by: TheFound for $9.30
customer_reviews.author: Rey A.

customer_reviews.title: works the way it should
customer_reviews.text: This works pretty much just the way you'd hope it does by the pictures. It provides power to be able to run/charge several devices that would have been too much for the one USB port provided by the computer...newer phones don't charge very quickly, but I figured that would be the case. Data speeds were adequate for my purposes...fyi, I did not do extensive testing, especially into the USB 3.0 range of speeds, it just didn't severely under-perform for my needs. And of course, you can turn off each port. Keep in mind, this means you turn off both data AND power to that device...this should be expected, but just in case you were wondering.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Extra USB ports a good idea
customer_reviews.text: I (and my colleague) needed additional USB port availability for our work laptops when our company decided to go to softphone options. While docked, my laptop only had one USB port available - which I was using for my wireless mouse - so I hopped online that afternoon and found this product and bought 2. They were delivered within 2 hours of completing my order - which was great. So both I and my colleague could use them first thing the next morning. This has worked well for me - glad to have it - and it will continue to be useful even outside of work.
customer_reviews.author: R. Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This product worked as it should from day one. I have 3 USB ports on my laptop, but for some reason only 1 works so this device has recreated my UBS port availability! The one downside is that it just dangles around. I wish it would insert into my USB port like an attachment to my laptop rather than a dangling cord. I suppose this wouldn't matter to much for someone who always uses the same work station/desk.
customer_reviews.author: A. Heart

customer_reviews.title: USB Switch
customer_reviews.text: Individual push-button switches for each of the four USB ports allows me to have four devices connected at all times, but not active or drawing power until I switch that port on. The ability to switch the ports on and off is what attracted me to this particular USB hub and it works great. I mounted it with double-sided tape.
customer_reviews.author: R. L. Everhart

customer_reviews.title: I now own 5 of these
customer_reviews.text: I love these units, they don't burn out like another brand, and I can attach all of my backup drives to my main computer. I have three running and two as spares - just in case. you can turn off/on individual ports - which is nice if you have something you just want to backup once a month. The blue LED light also clearly shows you what is turned on/off. The plugs are solid. Of course this is a plastic gadget - but for the price it's great. Only wish is that the cord were 6" longer so I'd have more flexibility about how I bundle my cords.
customer_reviews.author: Rice

customer_reviews.title: Weirdness Abpunds
customer_reviews.text: This little unit seems to work just perfectly. Except...I have a Logitech 11-button gaming mouse, I also have a SanDisk 232Gb flash drive. When I connect the flash drive my mouse stops working. This is not a deal breaker for me, I just plug the mouse receiver into another hub, a Sabrent 4-Port hub, and everything is happy. I have no idea why it is that way. I guess "It is what it is."
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Austin

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't snub this hub bub...
customer_reviews.text: It's my second order from a purchase several years ago and I needed a couple more for other reasons and am still using the one's I bought from several years ago, which is why I bought these again because I like them. I like that you can turn off and on the port and they fit my needs. Hopefully these new ones I just purchased are as long lasting as the other two I purchased several years ago... woooo hoooo.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Four-port USB Hub with reasonable functionality
customer_reviews.text: I like that this hub turns one USB port into four ports. The blue lights can be annoying at night and you'll have to turn off your PC to make them go away (for example at night while sleeping if you keep your PC in the bedroom). The latency for my keyboard and mouse is reasonable and there's no major delay. Occasionally I'll have to turn a port off and on a few times to make it start working again. It's a bit slow for data transfers on USB drives when using other devices with it but still works as expected. I've had it in continuous use for about a year now and haven't had many issues yet.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Suchy

customer_reviews.title: one problem
customer_reviews.text: I like the cord length and the idea that you can turn on and off each port. But that on and off button is where the problem is, every time I turn on or off a port, it ejects all the other ports as well. Example, I have two ports on, I turn on another port, the USBs that were previously plug in would be ejected. Same thing, if I turn off one, while the other ports are on, whatever was plugged in would be ejected. So, the buttons really do nothing because you have to keep them on all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick

customer_reviews.title: my logitech mouse doesn't work with it
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have said, it's very "hit or miss" what products actually work with this thing. For example, my Logitech m570 will eventually stop responding properly with it (within a minute or two). The only reason I'm not returning this for now is that it does seem to work with my microphone and UPS, so I still have a port left to plug the mouse directly into the computer. The build quality is decent for a product of this price range. If it worked with all peripherals it would be five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this product over 6 months now and I have no issue at all. But there is a downside to this product. The top or far left is for my mouse. The second port is connected to an external hard drive, WD elements. Only the mouse port is on, but the light bleeds through to the second as the second may also be on. This is very minor. The actual bug is when wd elements is on and I turn on the third USB port (total three ports are on), other ports blinks and unconnected and reconnected again in 2 seconds. Weird, right? Anyway, that issue resolves quickly, so I said this is good enough.
customer_reviews.author: S' review

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: well, it works, i used it for a few days until i could find something better. i used it to split a usb cable for mouse and keyboard. the problem is that half the time i boot the computer, i have to fiddle with the buttons on this adapter. no other problems and its the lowest price and it does work. but for an extra five dollar cost i replaced it with something i don't have to tend to. i got the: 4-Port USB 3.0 Hub, USB 3.0 Data HUB,USB Extension HUB,USB Splitter, Multiple USB Interfaces(5Gbps Transfer Speed, Anodized Alloy, Compact, Lightweight, for Mac and Windows OS) by FREEGENE no buttons. it also works.
customer_reviews.author: rawtimes

customer_reviews.title: Solid; works well
customer_reviews.text: In order to register the product at the Sabret website for the extended warranty, you'll need the serial number, which, unfortunately is printed only on the box (which I had, of course, discarded), not on the product itself. That aside, the build quality seems decent; it works, the on/off swiches for each port is a nice feature, I suppose. EDIT: I was wrong - they were able to register me without my having the box - I don't recall how now - maybe with the order number from Amazon? Anyway, works well.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Not work to detect all phones for data transfer
customer_reviews.text: I have an LG K51 cell phone wanted to use this to transfer data from phone to USB drive. Was at Staples it would not detect my cell phone with this Hub. Staples has a Next brand 2.0 hub they let me use at their computers instead on same day i used same cords to connect usb hub to my phone the $50 Staples Next brand USB hub reads my cell phone in less than 1 minutes whereas with this device the phone was not detected whatsoever so I could not do the transfer. I will have to return this item
customer_reviews.author: Jana H.

customer_reviews.title: Slim and Effective
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure at first about the individual lighted power buttons for the four USB sockets, but I think it might be useful for diverting power to prioritized peripherals. I do like that they are all on one side of the unit instead of both, or like the one I had before, three sides. My inner tree-hugger loves the slim design - and supportive yet slim packaging with minimal plastic! I've only been using the hub for the afternoon, but the power buttons seem sturdy, as does the cord (until my cats discover it, lol) Kudos, Sabrent!
customer_reviews.author: Leone

customer_reviews.title: Good Hub, Though Should Have Bought the 10 Port USB3 Hub Instead
customer_reviews.text: The "Sabrent 60W 7-Port USB 3.0 Hub + 3 Smart Charging Ports" has been a solid hub. I have a lot of devices I don't always need connected, like an external microphone and video camera, and I like the option to just switch those off manually. Yet, I now wish I'd bought the 10 USB3 port hub instead, without the charging ports, as I'm actually short on ports now and needed to buy another small hub. Plus, charging technology keeps changing, so I think it's better to have an external dedicated charging hub instead.
customer_reviews.author: A. E. Bogdan

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Working from home during this ever changing time and my neck was seriously hurting using my laptop keyboard. I only had one working USB port and my mouse was plugged into that port. Bought this to make my life easier and it is working great. As soon as I plugged it in my laptop installed the drivers with no problem. When I plugged in both my mouse dongle and my keyboard USB, and turned on the ports, they easily downloaded those drivers and I was working great in less than a minute. Quality is nice. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: LovesDarcy

customer_reviews.title: Great little USB hub, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've used this Sabrent 4-port USB 3.0 hub for about two weeks now, and so far it's been great – especially for the price. I have two external HDs connected to it, and the ability to turn the USB throughput and power on/off with the buttons is super handy; this allows me to keep the HDs connected without having to manually remove the USB plug from the PC. My only issue is the LED illuminated on/off buttons feel slightly flimsy, and may be prone to getting stuck with repeated use. But so far, so good. If anything changes in the next few months, I'll update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for these new computers or laptops that only have 1 or 2 usb cords.
customer_reviews.text: I just got a new desktop computer but the box only had 2 usb cord attachments. Well I tend to have more than just my mouse and my keyboard hooked up so I needed something that would give me the ability to not constantly have to unplug something and was small and compact. I love how small this adapter is. the cord is the perfect length to not be another tangled mess. You can turn on and off each usb port with a button and the lights are a nice touch as well. I would definitely recommend this to anyone with a computer who needs extra ports.
customer_reviews.author: kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Value is there, performance on PS4 as extended HuB Is NOT!
customer_reviews.text: Maybe mines defective? Or maybe this product is junk? I'm simply using this for my PS4 to run my wireless headphones and a wireless controller bluetooth dongle. It constantly either cuts out the controller and or the headphones constantly like there isn't enough power supplied. If I attach a 3rd thing let alone a 4th thing then nothing works at all. Over rated product and really disappointed I knew I should of spent $10 more and got the Anker one...never had any issues with any of their products.
customer_reviews.author: Chris W.

customer_reviews.title: My go-to always
customer_reviews.text: My PC is several years old and as the USB ports on the back started dying I ended up needing a USB Hub. My first one was Sabrent but a smaller one with less ports. I have been very pleased with the quality of their Hubs that my husband had also bought one for his PC. Once again I needed to expand my USB capacity so I've returned to Sabrent once more and couldn't be happier. I even found a use for my older one since it is still in great working condition and the older model is attached to my laptop in my writing studio.
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Had this connected to one home-built system and all was well. No surprises, no problems. Bought another system, Lenovo refurb and it destroyed the data on my external SSD, which I had to reformat to get working again. Could be a problem with the total power coming from the USB, but directly connected to the system there is no problem. I'll replace with a powered hub when I get around to it, and that's one more wire in the jungle behind my desk.. On the old system I had a number of things plugged in at the same time, and never had any problem.
customer_reviews.author: MiserableOldFart

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT USB HUB WITH ON/OFF FUNCTION
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a standard USB hub to this one for its ability to switch power on and off. In particular I have a USB mic that if plugged in remains powered on. Seeing no reason to have my mic always in ready mode and not wanting to always be physically plugging and unplugging it I thought this to be a good solution. The Sabrent HB-UM43 is performing well in my setup, allows for multiple devices to be plugged in while regulating the power draw by switching off un-needed devices. I like this product.
customer_reviews.author: RickR

customer_reviews.title: Multiply USB Lights Up your Power Problems!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these Sabrent 3.0 USB multiplugs in my house, 1 on my laptop, the other on a tv! Lifesavers! TV, plugs a soundbar, lite system, dvd player, in 1- the laptop has a lamp, phone charger, and pc fan hooked up! The best thing is the individual power buttons that light up when you turn on the power to that accessory! Great item EVERYBODY Should Have!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Ford

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT ... UNTIL IT JUST DOESN'T
customer_reviews.text: SO I BOUGHT MINE IN DECEMBER 2019, AND IT WORKED WITH ALL OF MY USB NEEDS FOR MY EXTERNAL SPEAKER, MY EXTERNAL VIDEO/PHOTO DEVICES, MY CELL PHONE AND ALL WAS WELL. BUT THEN, YESTERDAY (AUG. 15, 2020), THE LIGHTS WERE ON SHOWING POWER, BUT MY PHONE WASN'T CHARGING, MY EXTERNAL DEVICES DIDN'T SHOW UP ON MY LAPTOP AS BEING ATTACHED, AND SO IT GOT 8 MONTHS OF USE OUT OF A $10.00 PRODUCT, NOT BAD, BUT I WISH IT WOULD LAST LONGER...I HAVE LIGHTS AND NO ACTION LOL!! YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR
customer_reviews.author: Grannie

customer_reviews.title: Ok but awkward cord length
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. The individual switches are a nice feature. My only gripe is the cord length. It’s a very awkward length. Too long to act as a dongle style plugin and too short to allow the hub to sit securely on top of my new PC. So in order to prevent shorts occurring, I’m only left with the option of using some type of adhesive to stick this thing to the outside of a PC case with cosmetic LEDs. I suppose I could add a usb cord extender, but that’s just more I have to buy to get this to work.
customer_reviews.author: lh

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: This was my third purchase of this product, as I have gifted it to my husband and a friends who utilized it with his DJ equipment. I bought it originally when I switched to working remotely. I connect my laptop to a second screen, and utilize this to have a keyboard, headset, and mouse all in use at the same time. Previously I would have to make a choice between giving up my keyboard or mouse when I needed to use the headset The price/value is unbeatable.
customer_reviews.author: Health59

customer_reviews.title: Will corrupt your data! DO NOT USE!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these and was very excited about the simplicity and low cost of expanding my PC's USB 3.0 ports. I typically transfer 1GB to 200GB of data per day via USB 3.0 and manage as much as 20TB continually. Of the 2 units, 1 immediately corrupted 100% of data I transferred through it. The other worked fine for about 1 hour, then started corrupting 100% of data transferred through it (only reading about 20GB/35GB file). Pros: NONE Cons: Will corrupt data that you transfer/read/write/execute through this device Recommendation: DO NOT BUY! Request: Amazon.com please ban this product!
customer_reviews.author: N+B+O

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what is described. I used this for a computer setup, to which I have a variety of game controllers connected. Some games get confused with multiple controllers, so this is working well to turn off the unused controllers without having to unplug them. Overall, this is a great product at a great price. I wouldn't call it a complaint, but my only comment is that the blue lights from the buttons bleeds into the adjacent buttons, so when one is off, there is still some blue light showing. However, for a product that works at a price of $8, I can't criticize it too much.
customer_reviews.author: Xylem

customer_reviews.title: Switched ports helps prolong the lives of USB drive.
customer_reviews.text: Insert the drive first then switch it on; when done use safely remove option and switch the drive off. This will minimize the chance of electrical spikes that could kill or at least shorten the life of your USB drives. Especially valuable to protect expensive large capacity drives. Basics look good so far: drive is sturdy and appears durable; sockets neither too tight nor too loose. Time will tell how this -especially the switches- holds up but it appears pretty strong.
customer_reviews.author: Charles M. Romer

customer_reviews.title: Connect everything
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these on my desk (all with the hub power supply unless attached to my laptop charging USB port). They're convenient for connecting video cameras, cell phones, disk drives, microcomputers, PC scopes, etc., with a simple button push. I can disconnect my laptop easily by ejecting any open drives, unplugging the main USB hub, the power cord, and my HDMI monitor - almost as handy as a docking station - and the attached microcomputers can be left powered up and running.
customer_reviews.author: Robert R.Top Contributor: Arduino

customer_reviews.title: Works well! Like the buttons.
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of hassles with wi-fi computer accessories: keyboard, mouse, printer, etc. I needed something simpler: plugged in accessories. This usb hub fits my needs. Pros: I like the buttons. Yes, I have used them to turn power on /off to my printer. Cable is just a few inches long, but doesn't get in the way. I have connected a printer and a keyboard. Works well so far. More accessories to come! Cons: the plastic casing does seem to be a little thin. Take care of it, and it should last.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: So far so good - other than the blue LED lights bleeding even when it is turned off
customer_reviews.text: I am using it with my Fire TV Cube to attach wireless dongle keyboard, USB drive and USB-external drive. They all work even when all power buttons are lit up. I'm not sure if I got a defective one in regards to the blue USB light but the blue light of each button "bleeds" meaning even if I turn off one power button it still looks half lit up. It is not like the image on the product page. That is why I took out 1 star. So far that is my only complaint. If anything else comes up I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Anime, Manga and Harlequin Romance Girl

customer_reviews.title: Meh... buy a powered one if you plan on using more than 2 devices at a time.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I can hook up multiple devices to my laptop which has only one USB. The problem is- the power supply is not strong enough. So you can only actually use 1-2 devices. So if you have a USB hard drive (or two), want to charge your phone at the same time - your going to run into issues. Data transfer is slightly slower as well. For on the go - this is fine. For a permanent desk/docking station kind of idea - buy one that has a power supply.
customer_reviews.author: Carsten

customer_reviews.title: Poor performance
customer_reviews.text: This USB hub doesn't perform well. As some other reviewers mentioned, the performance is "choppy". I was hoping it was just a fluke but it seems to be the case for mine also. It's impossible to use a wireless keyboard or mouse with this hub. The mouse stutters across the screen in short choppy intervals with a lag, which makes it pretty much unusable. I was able to print without a noticeable problem, but since I need this to use with a keyboard/mouse wireless combo also, it'll be going back to Amazon. It's unfortunate, because it's a nice looking, compact unit, and it feels solid.
customer_reviews.author: Steve A

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good unit that performs as described. I ended up using a more close coupled hub, not because there was anything wrong with this one, but just because the other matched my computer and was close-coupled, so that it saves a bit of desk space and cuts down on cable clutter. A big advantage of this unit, for some, would be that it doesn't interfere with or block other computer ports, which could be a problem for some with a more close coupled unit. I suppose having individually switched ports could be a convenience as well, but I don't find plugging and unplugging to be that much of a problem.
customer_reviews.author: 1stHand

customer_reviews.title: Trashed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in July but I started to use it only in September when I came back from holiday. First, I kept having connections errors on my USB devices or 'USB device not recognized'. Turned out this was happening only when using this HUB. So I reverted it back to a simple charging station for my desk, and even this was not working correctly. I was so frustrated it ended up in my trash bin.
customer_reviews.author: Guillaume Gaillet

customer_reviews.title: They can do better
customer_reviews.text: Apparently these produce way too much interference, and can not be used with my PS4. Whenever this is plugged in it interferes with the Bluetooth signal of my controller. My stupid PlayStation only has two USB jacks and of course they don’t put one in the back of the unit. It is very easy to use up all the ports, headset dongle, charging spare controller, external hard drive, Fight stick, etc. I guess I will look for an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Mic

customer_reviews.title: Good product, excessive packaging
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed overall with the product, it works as expected and the quality is good. They lost one star for excessive packaging. I understand making sure that your product is protected on it's way to the consumer, but I would like it to be done in a way that is environmentally responsible. This item came packaged in a paperboard box, with a plastic hanging hook and a foam insert, making recycling much more challenging. The plastic hanger in unnecessary and a paper product could have been used for the insert. Ultimately I would like to see Sabrent use 100% post consumer paper for all of their packaging, and I would like the packaging details noted in the product description.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Evenson

customer_reviews.title: Works great, simple on/off functionality
customer_reviews.text: Good addition for your laptop bag or even your desktop setup. I wanted this because of the individual on/off toggle button for each port. When the port is on, the button is in the down position and the blue colour lights up. It looks like you cannot disable the light but it is not too bright. When my desktop is in sleep mode, I see the blue lights are still on but that is OK to me. I also use this with a USB 3.0 extension cable and I do not experience any problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality usb hub
customer_reviews.text: I have had many usb hubs over the years for various computers/setups and with many you will get random disconnects all the time which can be annoying and troublesome. So far this has been bullet proof, feels of high quality and have not had a single disconnect (windows usb disconnect/reconnect sound randomly going off). This may cost a few dollars more than some other ones available but so far with my experience the extra money is justified.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Great Concept, Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: 4 usb 3.0 ports, check. Long enough cord, check. Lights and power buttons for each usb port, check. It fails miserably on quality. Usb devices we're very difficult to insert into the usb ports. Felt like the ports were too small. Once all devices we're connected, when using the buttons to turn on or off a specific port, it caused ALL devices connected to the hub to disconnect from the host. Same behavior on multiple hosts. Epic fail. Had the device for 3.5 mins before returning. Sorry Sabrent... The Usb 2.0 version of this works well. What happened?
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: So far this has worked great. Having one usb port was very limiting so I needed something to add more. There are so many out there but I chose this one because of the on off for each individual port. I like the lights on it too. All of the things I have plugged into it have seem to work just fine. Im a bit concerned about overloading my computer but it seems ok so far. The quality seems really good and the length of the cord is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Tazzie

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly, needed an additional port and this fit the bill, seems well built and will last for a while, I'm not using any drives with the unit so far and it seems to be working normally, the only issue I have with it is the cord connection is on the left and not the right, this doesn't seem to be a big issue but if you run it off the back USB on your computer and run it out the left side then the ports are facing the wrong way, again not a major issue, just giving any future buyers a heads up,
customer_reviews.author: Tim E Holmberg

customer_reviews.title: Not Good for audio interfaces
customer_reviews.text: Hub introduces noise to audio interfaces when files are being accessed on HDD's connected to this same hub. Plugging the same interface into another USB3 port (not via this hub) works fine. Plugging the same interface to a different USB hub works fine. It's seem's that this model doesn't do a good job of isolating the ports. Even adding a device meant to filter out that interference, didn't fully tame it. Other than that it works as a hub. Transfers over 100 MBs can get flakey (SSD to HDD), but won't crash. Speeds under 100MBs are solid. (HDD to HDD)
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Solid and seems to support at least 7 connected devices without issue.
customer_reviews.text: I have a external hard disk, external CD/DVD drive, phone charger, scanner, printer, USB stick and flash card reader plugged in most of the time. No issues. I didn't notice any speed differences with the hard disk or reading USB stick from directly into my laptop. I love my laptop, but it really does not have enough ports to do what I want. Plus some left over if I want to connect something else. It has LEDs but they are not obtrusive. I won't rate on portability or for travelling because it is more or less a fixture on my desktop. If I want to take my laptop with me, it is just one cable to unplug.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Mcmillan

customer_reviews.title: best product you can get for the price.
customer_reviews.text: honestly I was a bit suprice with this little item. it comes with a USB-C adapter to USB A for you to connected on the right port but I did not know it was so convenient for me, I have a snowball microphone and a external aliinko camera that I have connect it to my Mac mini , but with this im able to shut it off and on when im not using those devices giving me great confort and assurance of my privacy against hackers or wrong use of my image or sound , and only 10 dollars come on. great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Al Jose Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I just got a new laptop, but the one downside to it is the presence of only one USB port. I use the Logitech connector that allows me to run up to six things using the one little connector, but I am also taking a course in transcription and I have a foot pedal and headphones, plus a gadget that will enhance the audio for me if necessary--all needing a USB port. I found this on Amazon and it seemed just the ticket. Glad to say it arrived expediently and it is working faboulously.

product_meta.title: Sabrent 4-Port USB 3.0 Hub with Individual LED Power Switches | 2 Ft Cable | Slim & Portable | for Mac & PC (HB-UM43)
product_meta.description:
Capacity:4-Port USB 3.0 Hub

Add up to 4 devices with the efficient, effectual Sabrent 4-Port USB 3.0 Hub. The thin, lightweight design makes the Sabrent 4-port USB 3.0 hub a great travel companion to expand your laptop’s USB 3.0 port into four. Fully backwards compatible with the USB 2.0/1.1 products. Additionally, each port has its own power switch, allowing for individual port control. With SuperSpeed USB 3.0, you can now transfer data at up to 10 times the speeds of the older USB 2.0 standards. Speeds of 5Gbps are a vast improvement over USB 2.0’s 480Mbps top speed. The Sabrent 4-Port USB Hub utilizes the most advanced technology, but it is also backwards compatible, allowing you the capability of using USB 2.0/1.1 products if need be. Please Note: 2.4Ghz wireless devices, such as wireless keyboard and mouse adapters, may not work in close proximity to USB 3.0 devices or hubs. Connecting to a USB 2.0 port is recommended. For a stable connection, the devices connected to the 4-Port USB 3.0 Hub must not exceed a combined current of 5 volts 900 mAh. External hard-drives should be connected to an external power source. This 4-Port USB 3.0 Hub will not charge your devices, it will only sync.

Compatibility - Windows PC, MAC OS X, USB 0.3
feature_bullets: EXPANSION: Instantly add 4 USB 3.0 Ports to Any compatible device. Transform a single USB port into a full work station. The extended 2 ft cable allows for the perfect set up and easy access to out of the way ports.
CONVENIENCE: LED Indicators display power status for each port. Individual on/off switches enable you to easily connect and disconnect your devices with the push of a button.
SUPER SPEEDS: Supports transfer speeds up to 5Gbps (USB 3.0), 480Mbps (USB 2.0), & 12Mbps (USB 1.1). Fast enough to transfer large files in seconds.
COMPATIBILITY: Reverse compatible with USB 2.0 and USB 1.1 devices. Use with PC, MacBook, iMac, Mac mini, XPS, Flash Drives, & any other USB compatible devices.
EASY SETUP: No driver installation required; Plug & Play and Hot Swappable. Does NOT support charging.
